Description: Shoulder fragment of an Attic black-figured pottery olpe. Preserved part of siren (back of head and wing) to right; rosette in upper band; added red for the wing and alternate petals of the rosette. Inside of neck glazed, with dribble of paint below.
Producer name: Attributed to: Ceramicus Painter (or near him (Venit))
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit: 'Near the Ceramicus Painter and may be by the painter himself; joins Oxford G 137.15 (CVA Great Britain 9: pl. 1 fig. 32; ABV 14, 7; 20, 1; Paralipomena 9, 7) [Beazley, for the Oxford fragment].'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 81 no. 269 pl. 61)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1209)
